title: Internet Evolution in Pakistan (1995–2024)
introduction: The evolution of the internet in Pakistan is a story of transformation — from elite access in a few universities to nationwide 4G and 5G networks empowering millions.
This timeline showcases the major technical, social, and policy-driven milestones that brought Pakistan into the digital age.

timeline.title: First Public Internet Access
timeline.description: Digicom launches Pakistan's first public dial-up internet service in Karachi, with speeds under 56 kbps.

timeline.title: PTCL Launches National Dial-Up
timeline.description: Pakistan Telecommunication Company Limited (PTCL) expands dial-up access to major cities, making home internet possible.

timeline.title: DSL Broadband Introduced
timeline.description: PTCL introduces DSL broadband with packages starting from 128 Kbps to 512 Kbps, revolutionizing connectivity for offices and tech users.

timeline.title: Wi-Tribe and Wateen Wireless
timeline.description: Wireless ISPs like Wi-Tribe and Wateen enter the market with WiMAX and CDMA solutions, offering prepaid internet for students and homes.

timeline.title: YouTube Culture Begins
timeline.description: The rise of YouTube and digital content consumption influences youth culture, education, and entertainment habits.

timeline.title: 3G and 4G Spectrum Auction
timeline.description: PTA conducts Pakistan’s first 3G/4G auction. Zong, Telenor, Mobilink, and Ufone deploy high-speed mobile broadband.

timeline.title: Mobile-First Generation
timeline.description: Smartphone adoption crosses 50 million. Apps like WhatsApp, Facebook, and Snapchat become daily tools.

timeline.title: COVID-19 and Digital Shift
timeline.description: Pandemic forces online education, remote work, and digital transformation. Platforms like Zoom and Google Meet rise sharply.

timeline.title: Fiber Internet Expansion
timeline.description: ISPs like StormFiber and Nayatel offer gigabit speeds in urban areas. Video streaming and gaming take off.

timeline.title: 5G Pilot Trials
timeline.description: 5G pilot tests begin in Islamabad and Lahore, with demo speeds crossing 1 Gbps. The future of smart cities begins.

timeline.title: National Broadband Policy
timeline.description: Government introduces a digital inclusion policy to connect 95% of the population by 2030, with a focus on rural access and youth skills.
